input:

26:48 Event: Goal by Barcelona
27:00 Caption: Goal! Luis Suarez (Barcelona) picks up a pass and gets to the edge of the box before clipping a brilliant lob over the goalkeeper and into the empty net. He makes it 0:2.

31:46 Event: Offside by Las Palmas

00:00 Event: Kick-off by Las Palmas

Lionel Messi (Barcelona) finds some space inside the box and gets in a strike, but the shot is brilliantly blocked by one of the defending players sliding in. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Barcelona will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
09:34 Event: Corner by Barcelona

14:48 Event: Ball out of play

15:10 Event: Corner by Las Palmas

18:16 Event: Kick-off by Barcelona
19:21 Caption: Pedro Bigas (UD Las Palmas) is clearly asking for some medical attention with his painful gestures. The extent of his injury is yet to be discovered.
21:06 Caption: Pedro Bigas (UD Las Palmas) seems to have picked up a minor injury, but it looks like he will be able to continue playing.
21:41 Event: Goal by Barcelona
21:42 Event: Goal by Barcelona
22:00 Caption: A perfect lofted pass from Ivan Rakitic finds Neymar (Barcelona), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the right side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Javi Varas had no chance of stopping that. 1:3.
22:34 Event: Kick-off by Las Palmas
22:41 Event: Foul by Las Palmas

25:51 Event: Goal by Barcelona
26:00 Caption: Goal! Jordi Alba displays great vision and sends a pass to Neymar (Barcelona), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 1:4.
26:07 Caption: The game has come to an end for Figueroa Cabrera Momo. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Alen Halilovic (UD Las Palmas).

32:23 Event: Substitution by Las Palmas

32:54 Event: Ball out of play

39:19 Event: Substitution by Las Palmas

41:52 Caption: The resulting corner comes to nothing as Neymar (Barcelona) sends it out of play.
41:59 Event: Corner by Barcelona
42:05 Event: Ball out of play

45:50 Caption: Neymar (Barcelona) decides to speed play up with a short corner kick.
46:58 Caption: Jese (UD Las Palmas) found himself in a promising position. He ran towards the goal and unleashed a shot from just outside the penalty area which went towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper was ready and made a decent save.
47:11 Caption: That's it for today, Gonzalez Gonzalez has blown his whistle and the game is over.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a thrilling encounter at the Estadio de Gran Canaria, FC Barcelona showcased their dominance with a resounding 4-1 victory over UD Las Palmas. The match, played in front of an enthusiastic crowd of 22,268 spectators, saw the Catalan giants exert their influence from the kickoff and secure a memorable win.

The game commenced with Barcelona taking the first touch at 00:00. The opening minute and a half were fairly uneventful, but by 00:34, Barcelona had already committed their first foul. Shortly afterward, Las Palmas aimed to capitalize on their defensive lapse and earned a corner at 01:16, but nothing came of it. Barcelona's initial defensive strengths were tested again by a series of ball clearances and offsides, but they steadied their play and gained greater control as the minutes passed.

The match first sparked to life through the boot of Barcelona's star, Lionel Messi. Around the 13-minute mark, Messi was in a promising position outside the penalty area and fired a powerful shot. However, his effort was heroically blocked by a Las Palmas defender, illustrating the hosts' initial determination to challenge Barcelona.

A defining moment came soon after when Neymar, another of Barcelona's luminaries, attempted to slide a skillful pass to a teammate around the 17th minute. Although this specific play was blocked by the robust Las Palmas defense and resulted in a corner, it marked a shift in momentum. Neymar's lurking danger was palpable. Luis Suarez's header off a subsequent corner was ruled offside, signaling Barcelona's unrelenting offensive pressure but also hinting at their need for discipline in their positioning.

By the 18th minute, the game was momentarily interrupted due to injuries to Jonathan Viera of Las Palmas and Lucas Digne of Barcelona, both requiring treatment on the pitch. Thankfully, both players were able to continue play, adding to the intensity of the contest.

Barcelona's perseverance paid off spectacularly in the 24th minute. Luis Suarez, an instrumental figure throughout the match, orchestrated a fine sequence leading to the opener. After sending a precise pass to Neymar, Suarez saw his teammate finish with aplomb into an empty net, drawing first blood for Barcelona.

Hardly had the jubilations subsided before Barcelona doubled their lead. In the 27th minute, Luis Suarez, once more at the fore, latched onto a pass and, showing his adept striking capabilities, chipped the ball beautifully over the Las Palmas goalkeeper. The scoreline read 0-2 in Barcelona's favor, stunning the home crowd into a silence save for the visiting fans' cheers.

Despite the setbacks, Las Palmas were not without fight. They had their chances, notably with Roque Mesa's effort straight at Marc-Andre ter Stegen in the 30th minute, which symbolized their brief spells of offensive ingenuity. But these opportunities too frequently lacked the necessary penetration and accuracy to trouble the visiting side comprehensively.

Barcelona's dominance persisted as the game progressed towards the end of the first half. Neymar and Suarez both found themselves flagged for offside, indicative of their relentless pursuit to add to Barcelona’s tally. Close upon the interval, Neymar squandered a promising chance, picking up a rebound but ultimately firing a tame effort easily gathered by the goalkeeper.

The first-half concluded with a controversial incident where Andres Iniesta was penalized for a foul, marking the fourth key foul by Barcelona. At the halftime whistle, Barcelona players headed into the dressing room with a comfortable 2-0 advantage, reflecting their superior display.

As the second half kicked off, Las Palmas needed a response to regain foothold in the match. The early stages after the restart saw both sides exchange some fouls, reflecting a measured yet tense battle. Kevin-Prince Boateng had a golden opportunity to bring Las Palmas back into the game around the 53rd minute but failed to convert his header, sending it wide off the post.

Barcelona, despite their lead, remained resolute in defense with timely clearances and disciplined play. Their midfield maestro, Sergio Busquets, was booked for a trip, awarding Las Palmas a promising free-kick situation in the 57th minute, which Figueroa Cabrera Momo squandered by ballooning his shot high over the bar.

The home side’s efforts finally bore fruit in the 63rd minute. Jesé's brilliant pass found Pedro Bigas in the penalty area. Bigas, capitalizing on this chance, hammered a low shot past Ter Stegen, reducing the deficit to 1-2 and igniting hopes of a comeback among the local supporters.

Barcelona, however, remained unphased by this shift in momentum. Their response was swift and decisive. Neymar completed his brace in the 68th minute, where Ivan Rakitic's perfect lofted pass found him. Neymar leaped highest and headed the ball with precision into the goal, utter brilliance that rendered the Las Palmas goalkeeper helpless. The score now stood at 1-3.

Further salt was rubbed into Las Palmas's wounds as Barcelona netted again within minutes. This time, it was Jordi Alba exhibiting great vision to assist Neymar, who completed his hat-trick with a composed finish into the bottom right corner as the match clocked 71 minutes. Neymar’s performance was electric, cementing the Brazilian’s status as the hero of the game and putting Barcelona comfortably ahead at 1-4.

The game saw further substitutions with fresh legs like Andre Gomes and Paco Alcacer coming in for Barcelona, and Alen Halilovic and Javi Castellano among others for Las Palmas. Yet, despite these changes, the pattern of play remained largely unchanged.

Las Palmas's sporadic attempts to salvage pride fell short. On the defensive end, they were caught offside multiple times, disrupting any fluidity they might have hoped to establish. Their attacks, while at times promising - as evidenced by Jonathan Viera and Jesé’s combined efforts - lacked the final product.

Barcelona, in control and looking to manage the game, continued to maintain possession and launch occasional threats. Lionel Messi, still seeking to put his name on the scoresheet, had a shot in the 83rd minute that hit the defensive wall from a free-kick.

As the final minutes ticked away, Denis Suarez's attempt was blocked and led to a corner but resulted in no further change to the scoreline. The match referee Gonzalez Gonzalez's whistle finally brought an end to proceedings, confirming a convincing 4-1 win for the visiting Barcelona side.

It was a game marked by Barcelona’s offensive brilliance and tactical superiority. Neymar's hat-trick and Luis Suarez’s contributions epitomized Barcelona’s attacking prowess, while Marc-Andre ter Stegen’s assured goalkeeping ensured their defensive solidity. Las Palmas displayed moments of creativity and were rewarded with a goal but were ultimately outclassed by a superior footballing side.

This victory not only added three crucial points to Barcelona’s tally but also showcased their depth and strength, reinforcing their title credentials in the domestic league. It was a match to remember for the traveling fans at the Estadio de Gran Canaria as Barcelona marched confidently towards their seasonal objectives.
